etomica.data

Class DataSourceUniform.LimitType

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.util.EnumeratedType
      • etomica.data.DataSourceUniform.LimitType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    DataSourceUniform

    public static class DataSourceUniform.LimitType
extends EnumeratedType
    Typed constant that indicates the way limits of the range are interpreted. Choices for the left and right limits may be made independently.
    • INCLUSIVE indicates that the end point of the series equals the limit.
    • HALF_STEP indicates that the end point lies one half interval-step from the limit.
    • EXCLUSIVE indicates that the end point lies one full interval-step from the limit.
    For example, with n = 3 points and limits of 0.0 and 1.0, and with the left point (0.0) taken to have limitType = INCLUSIVE, the values are as follows for the different choices of the limitType of the right point (1.0):
    • INCLUSIVE: 0.0, 0.5, 1.0
    • HALF_STEP: 0.0, 0.4, 0.8
    • EXCLUSIVE: 0.0, 0.333, 0.667
    To get values that lie at the centers of a set of bins (e.g., for histogramming), use HALF_STEP for both limits.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static DataSourceUniform.LimitType EXCLUSIVE
      Limit type indicating that specified limit is not included in the range, and that the extreme value should be one full step from the specified limit.
      static DataSourceUniform.LimitType HALF_STEP
      Limit type indicating that extreme value should be one half step from the specified limit.
      static DataSourceUniform.LimitType INCLUSIVE
      Limit type indicating that limit is included in range, and that it equals the extreme value.
